    about this guide

    Some descriptions, history, and practices of the technical chair role in the annual ACH conference.

    2025-10-27

    winnieepm

    The Technical Chair and Technical Co-Chair are chiefly in charge of creating and running the technical infrastructure for the annual virtual conference of the Association for Computational Humanities (ACH). In recent years, this has included setting up/updating a dedicated website for the conference, supporting the maintenance/updating of ConfTool, and running the WorkAdventure location.

    Core Responsibilities

    1. Conference Website
      • Create âœ…
      • Populate content
    2. ConfTool
      • Purchase (in the works)
      • Initial setup; confirm settings imported correctly
      • CFP
      • Test all features
      • Proposal submissions
      • Review assignments and workflow
      • Email/communications
      • Program
      • Certificates for reviewers, volunteers, attendees
      • Collaborate with Program Lead to assign sessions to accepted papers
    3. Zoom
      • Coordinate with treasurer to purchase appropriate licenses
      • Review, update, finalize configuration
      • Set up Zoom rooms for each session
    4. Work Adventure
      • Create map(s)
      • Test functionality
      • Update Work Adventure guides
